documentation.text:
@title PBM interface 
 @notice The PBM (purpose bound money) allows us to add logical requirements on the use of ERC-20 tokens. The PBM acts as wrapper around the ERC-20 tokens and implements the necessary logic.

@notice Allows the creator of the PBM type to retrive all the locked up ERC-20 once they have expired for that particular token type
 @param tokenId The identifier of the PBM token type

@title PBM interface 
 @notice The PBM (purpose bound money) allows us to add logical requirements on the use of ERC-20 tokens. The PBM acts as wrapper around the ERC-20 tokens and implements the necessary logic.

@notice Allows the creator of the PBM type to retrive all the locked up ERC-20 once they have expired for that particular token type
 @param tokenId The identifier of the PBM token type

params.ERC20Token: The address of the underlying ERC-20 token
params.ERC20TokenValue: The number of underlying ERC-20 tokens transferred
params.amounts: The number of ( quantity ) the different PBM types that are to be created
params.from: The account from which the PBM ( NFT )(s) is moving from
params.to: The account which is receiving the PBM ( NFT )(s)
params.tokenIds: The identifiers of the different PBM token type

params.ERC20Token: The address of the underlying ERC-20 token
params.ERC20TokenValue: The number of underlying ERC-20 tokens transferred
params.PBMTokenId: The identifiers of the different PBM token type
params.beneficiary: the address ( PBM type creator ) which receives the ERC20 Token

params.amounts: The number of the PBMs that are to be created for each tokenId
params.receiver: The wallet address to which the created PBMs need to be transferred to
params.tokenIds: The identifiers of the PBM token type

params.tokenId: The identifier of the PBM token type

returns._0: name The name assigned to the token type
returns._1: amount Amount of the underlying ERC-20 tokens the PBM type wraps around
returns._2: expiry The expiry date (in epoch) for this particular PBM token type.
returns._3: creator The creator of the PBM token type

params._spotToken: address of the underlying ERC20 token

params.amount: The number of the PBMs that are to be created
params.receiver: The wallet address to which the created PBMs need to be transferred to
params.tokenId: The identifier of the PBM token type
The identifier of the PBM token type

params.amounts: The number of ( quantity ) the different PBM types that are to be created
params.data: To record any data associated with the transaction, can be left blank if none.
params.from: The account from which the PBM ( NFT )(s) is moving from
params.ids: The identifiers of the different PBM token type
params.to: The account which is receiving the PBM ( NFT )(s)

params.amount: The number of (quantity) the PBM type that are to be transferred of the PBM type
params.data: To record any data associated with the transaction, can be left blank if none
params.from: The account from which the PBM ( NFT ) is moving from
params.id: The identifier of the PBM token type
params.to: The account which is receiving the PBM ( NFT )

params.tokenId: The identifier of the PBM token type

returns._0: uri The URI link , which will povide a response that follows the Opensea metadata standard

MerchantPayment(address,address,uint256[.notice: Emitted when underlying ERC-20 tokens are transferred to a whitelisted merchant ( payment )

PBMrevokeWithdraw(address,uint256,addres.notice: Emitted when a PBM type creator withdraws the underlying ERC-20 tokens from all the remaining expired PBMs

batchMint(uint256[],uint256[],address).notice: Creates new PBM copies ( ERC2255 NFT ) of multiple existing PBM token types after ensuring they are backed by the necessary value of the underlying ERC-20 tokens

createPBMTokenType(string,uint256,uint25.notice: example response of token URI, ref : https://docs.opensea.io/docs/metadata-standards {     "name": "StraitsX-12",     "description": "12$ SGD test voucher",     "image": "https://gateway.pinata.cloud/ipfs/QmQ1x7NHakFYin9bHwN7zy4NdSYS84w6C33hzxpZwCAFPu",     "attributes": [         {         "trait_type": "Value",          "value": "12"         }     ] }

getTokenDetails(uint256).notice: Get the details of the PBM Token type

initialise(address,uint256,address).notice: sets the address of the underlying ERC20 token, Contract Expiry, and the address of pbm address list

mint(uint256,uint256,address).notice: Creates new PBM copies ( ERC2255 NFT ) of an existing PBM token type after ensuring it is backed by the necessary value of the underlying ERC-20 tokens

revokePBM(uint256).notice: Allows the creator of the PBM type to retrive all the locked up ERC-20 once they have expired for that particular token type

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.notice: Transfers the PBM(NFT)(s) from one wallet to another.  If the receving wallet is a whitelisted merchant wallet address, the PBM(NFT)(s) will be burnt and the underlying ERC-20 tokens will be transferred to the merchant wallet instead.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: Transfers the PBM(NFT) from one wallet to another.  If the receving wallet is a whitelisted merchant wallet address, the PBM(NFT) will be burnt and the underlying ERC-20 tokens will be transferred to the merchant wallet instead.

uri(uint256).notice: Get the URI of the tokenid

userdoc.notice: The PBM (purpose bound money) allows us to add logical requirements on the use of ERC-20 tokens. The PBM acts as wrapper around the ERC-20 tokens and implements the necessary logic.
